intro: Tylophora sublanceolata var. auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate tylophora, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with auriculate (ear-shaped) bases. The plant produces small, fragrant, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by fleshy, orange-red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
